basics.name: Fernando Flores
basics.label: Computer Engineering Graduate
basics.summary: Computer Engineering graduate focused on cloud computing and data engineering, with hands-on experience in Linux environments and software development using Python and Java. Strong interest in data processing and modern cloud-based architectures.

work.name: PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC)
work.summary: Internship focused on cloud-based enterprise systems and data analysis within Oracle Cloud environments.
highlights: Worked with Oracle Cloud technologies including Fusion Cloud, Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC), and Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI)
Built reports using OTBI and BI Publisher (BIP) with SQL queries to analyze business data and support decision-making

work.name: FES Aragón - PC Puma / Computer Center
work.summary: Provided technical support for academic computer labs and assisted students and faculty with software, hardware, and programming-related issues.
highlights: Diagnosed and resolved software and hardware technical issues
Assisted students and professors with programming-related topics
Automated update processes in computer labs, improving efficiency

education.institution: Facultad de Estudios Superiores Aragón - UNAM

projects.name: Schedule Generator
projects.description: Web application that generates multiple class schedule options based on user-defined preferences.
highlights: Developed using Python, Flask, and SQLite
Implemented a backtracking algorithm to generate all possible schedule combinations
Designed REST endpoints and dynamic views for real-time interaction

projects.name: 480 App
projects.description: Android mobile application that helps university students track and manage their complementary academic hours.
highlights: Implemented dynamic charts and progress visualization
Designed user-friendly forms for activity registration and tracking
